p: The proximate compositions of flours are presented in Table 2. Protein, fat, ash, total fibers, and crude fibers contents were significantly higher ( p < 0.001) in both chickpea flours compared to the refined wheat flour. However, moisture and carbohydrate contents were detected to be considerably lower. Chickpea flours appeared to be of higher nutritional value compared to refined wheat flour in terms of proteins, fat, ash, and fibers. These findings were in line with those reported by Hefnawy et al. [ 8].
